title: Self-Directed Lumbar Puncture Training Program Utilizing Integrated Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic anatomy and medical procedure knowledge
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented educational environment targeting medical professionals

learning_goals: Learners can explain the functional relationship between anatomical structures and the lumbar puncture procedure.
Learners can perform lumbar puncture techniques with over 80% accuracy through simulator-based training.
Learners can retain conceptual knowledge at 75% or higher in assessments one week later and apply it to real clinical scenarios
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
